reviewText:
The DVD moves way too slow.  After a few tries, I walked away.
I wouldn't recommend this to anyone who is starting to play the bass.

This is a friendly dvd for beginners out there. You don't have to know how to read music since tabs are shown.  All scales are repeated at a slow pace which makes it easy to learn.  One of the best DVD's.

This dvd had many different scale types shown relatively rapidly. I felt it didn't spend time explaining in detail. It is great as an overview of the various types of scales, but lacks if you are looking, as I was, as a beginner.

I think the bass, the instrument, should stand out more. During a lesson the instructor talks incessantly- over each note played. I would like to just hear the note. The talk could come before or after a run, not during. Picky, picky, picky.

As a beginner bassist I'm always looking for the most clear and precise instruction.  This DVD couldn't get any easier!  Step by step in slow and clear direction and then speed-ed up to get the full effect.  This covers the basic yet very important part of becoming a 360 bassist.  Great DVD to have in your repertoire of learning and practice material.
Great Product!  Great Price!  Great Packaging!  Great Quality!  What can I say, GREAT People to do business with.  Thanks fellas!  Cheers ><>
This is the best beginner scale instruction dvd that i've come across.  the instructor does a wonderful job of simplifying the content.  this should go under - so easy even a baby can do it.
This wasn't worth much to me, explanations were rudimentary and didn't help with application very much.  For me it was a waste of money.
Verry inspiring just what I needed to go to next level.thanks
I have not had a chance to check out out yet, but I'm sure it will be all it says it is.
Would be 5 star if it had better sound quality
Well put together. Turn on a metronome and go to work. Good daily drill.
looks okay have yet to use it
